CatDescriptText: Mr. John Redmun, 6447 Frankstown Avenue, East Liberty, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 4, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?" answer reads: "Yes, there should be. The reason is that there is too much confusion.  Regardless of what the workers get, they are back in a year or so, for another raise.  As soon as a raise is given, there is a raise in cost of the product or in the case of the trolleys, a raise in the rates."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Redmun wearing fedora and light colored jacket, holding pipe in right hand, standing on sidewalk with Courier reporter in front of Pool Room
